forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 9pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. South wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South southwest wind around 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As twilight descends upon Downtown San Francisco, the air carries with it the scent of rain, thick and anticipatory. Clouds blanket the sky, their weight a reminder of the showers that are likely to come tonight, with a chill that whispers around the corners of the streets. The temperature flirts with coolness, hovering just above fifty, while a light breeze stirs, hinting at an unsettled atmosphere. The chance of rain looms at sixty percent, suggesting that the delicate curtain of drizzle may soon draw across the city, dancing over the pavement and kissing the rooftops.

Tomorrow’s forecast holds a similar intrigue, with a cloud-laden sky promising a continuation of this peculiarly damp embrace, though the afternoon may offer a slight reprieve as temperatures dip into the mid-fifties. The chance of rain remains steady at fifty percent, ensuring the presence of moisture in the air and perhaps a fine mist softening the outlines of the familiar skyline. As you venture out into the evening or the morrow, consider dressing in layers, a cozy embrace of warmth and versatility suited for the briskness that mingles with the damp. Heavy jackets, comfortable scarves, and waterproof footwear will serve you well against the elements. In such atmospheric conditions, a quiet stroll through the neighborhood or an evening spent at a cozy café, savoring the rich warmth of a freshly brewed drink, might be just the remedy for those seeking solace in these moody, misty moments.
